text: Gary Beals (born October 25, 1982) is a Canadian singer who is best known for being the second-place finisher in the first season of the reality television series Canadian Idol. He is a resident of Cherry Brook, Nova Scotia. == Career == After losing to Ryan Malcolm on the Canadian Idol, he released a self- titled debut CD in August 2004. His first album, Gary Beals, entered the Canadian album charts at Number 10 and went on to sell 110,000 copies. His second album, The Rebirth Of..., was released on June 9, 2009. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Album ! colspan="1"| Peak ! rowspan="2"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="35"| CAN |- | 2004 | Gary Beals |align="center"| 10 | |- | 2009 | The Rebirth Of... |align="center"| — | |- | align="center" colspan="8"| "—" denotes the album did not chart. |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"| Year !rowspan="2"| Single !colspan="1"| Chart peaks !rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" !width="30"|CAN |- | rowspan="3"| 2004 |"Summer Nights" |align="center"| 4 | rowspan="3"|Gary Beals |- |"I've Changed" |align="center"| — |- |"Not That Strong" |align="center"| — |- | rowspan="2"| 2009 |"I Know You're Out There" |align="center"| — | rowspan="2"|The Rebirth Of... |- |"Jump Off" (featuring Blessed) |align="center"| — |- |} "—" denotes releases that did not chart. ==References== ==External links== *Gary Beals – Official Website Category:1982 births Category:Black Canadian singers Category:Black Nova Scotians Category:Canadian Idol participants Category:Canadian male singers Category:Canadian contemporary R&B; singers Category:Musicians from Halifax, Nova Scotia Category:Living people Category:21st-century male singers
